intro: Polycarpon indicum, commonly known as Indian sandparsley, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its丛生 (clumped) growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive silvery-gray appearance due to dense pubescence. Native to temperate regions of Asia, it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
